source_sentence: 如是微妙金剛義　　不離現前一念心　觀心具足般若經　　亦復具足餘妙典　十二分教二種藏　　乃至量等大千經　於一念中悉剖出　　一切諸念亦復然　如於念念剖大經　　一切根塵亦如是　乃至無有少許塵　　而不具足法界藏　如是正慧應了知　　一切惟心心一切　若不觀心類說藥　　真藥現前亦不知　是故我今稽首禮　　性具三德無遺者　一一啟請勸觀心　　速登般若金剛岸金剛般若波羅蜜經觀心釋(終)
translation: Thus, even though the subtle meaning of the vajra doesn't part from a single present thought, contemplation of the mind is complete with the prajñāpāramitā sūtras, it's also complete with the other marvelous scriptures, the two kinds of canon of the twelve parts of the teaching, up to the great chiliocosm of measurement, and so forth. As the great sūtras are cut open in each recitation, so are all the faculties and dust, even to the point that there's not a single particle that isn't complete with the store of the Dharma realm. Thus, correct wisdom should reveal that all things are nothing but the mind and all things in the mind.
